title: 113_s1466
content: The Secretary of Agriculture conducts regulatory review. The Administrator and Secretary are defined in this section. An agricultural entity is also defined as an entity involved in agricultural activities. The Secretary of Agriculture is responsible for reviewing notices related to guidance and policies issued by the Administrator. The Administrator and Secretary oversee the preparation of guidance, policies, regulations, and statements affecting agricultural entities. This includes regulatory agendas, plans, and publications that may impact a significant number of agricultural entities. The Administrator and Secretary are responsible for preparing guidance, policies, regulations, and statements that may impact agricultural entities. The Secretary must gather information and produce an economic impact statement for items that could affect a substantial number of agricultural entities. The Secretary must identify individuals from agricultural entities for advice on potential impacts and convene a review panel for analysis of the publication item. The review panel will review any information obtained. The Secretary will review information related to the publication item, gather advice from agricultural entity representatives, analyze the recommendations, and make suggestions to the Secretary. Comments must be submitted to the Administrator within 60 days of convening the review panel. The Secretary will review and submit comments on planned guidance to the Administrator, including concerns of agricultural entities, review panel findings, Secretary's findings, and recommendations. Comments will be published in the Federal Register and made available to the public. The Secretary may waive review initiation. The Secretary may waive initiation of the review panel as deemed appropriate.
